q.quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
q.author: Salvador Dali

q.quote: To me - old age is always ten years older than I am.
q.author: Bernard Baruch

q.quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
q.author: Salvador Dali

q.quote: Sadly, it's much easier to create a desert than a forest.
q.author: James Lovelock

q.quote: Over and over I marvel at the blessings of my life: Each year has grown better than the last.
q.author: Lawrence Welk

q.quote: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
q.author: Christopher Morley

q.quote: I know I am getting better at golf because I am hitting fewer spectators.
q.author: Gerald R. Ford

q.quote: Sadly, it's much easier to create a desert than a forest.
q.author: James Lovelock

q.quote: It takes a long time to become young.
q.author: Pablo Picasso

q.quote: The heart will break, but broken live on.
q.author: James Lovelock

q.quote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
q.author: Walt Disney

q.quote: Just remember, once you're over the hill you begin to pick up speed.
q.author: Walt Disney

q.quote: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.
q.author: James Lovelock

q.quote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
q.author: Walt Disney

q.quote: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
q.author: Billie Jean King
